summary_comment: Professor Locke's teaching is characterized by frequent, challenging quizzes that do not always align with the weekly content, requiring extensive preparation through multiple sources. The class structure is perceived as poorly organized and potentially intimidating, with a focus on quiz performance over deep learning. Students find the material rushed and the quizzes difficult to prepare for effectively, though there are opportunities for extra credit.

Ratings.comment: Weekly quizzes often did not seem to reflect the weekly content. You can attend both lectures for the content, watch the pre recorded videos, and do the optional practice problems, and there will still be a problem you've never seen before. I would highly recommend doing the optional problems on zybooks.
Class is structured very poorly, and not very helpful in lectures. Very passive aggressive, gets oddly upset when people pack up a minute early.

This class was super annoying, a quiz every Friday morning, and 4 hour review videos if you wanted to study. Often times I would get a better grade if I guessed on the quizzes than if I tried to study and prepare. She was very passive-aggressive and would make students feel very intimidated. There are some opportunities for extra credit though.

Be ready to watch 3 hours of videos and attend lectures to be prepared for the weekly quizzes. Class is less focused on learning than doing well on quizzes due to amount of content. She asked for feedback mid-semester just to change nothing. Only plus is the amount of extra points available which bring your grade up a lot at the end of semester.
Rushed material, quizzes every Friday with difficulty to prepare, long readings that do not invite real learning. Retained low amounts of information due to the rushed course layout.

Overall Professor Lock is alright. When approached though she made you feel quite dumb. I avoided her after talking to her. There are quizzes every week, but you can get some points back by correcting your quiz. There's lots to read.

I think Prof. Locke is a good professor but I believe Prof. Brown is better at explaining what is needed for the weekly quizzes. I had a hard time following her lectures in comparison, and there was less explanation in general of the stuff on the quizzes.

you take a 40 point quiz every single week. there's a lot of opportunity to earn points back but there is a lot of homework and those quizzes will tank your grade. also professor locke does not like being contacted about grades so don't even try to ask.
prof locke is a great instructor. 100% recommend

Professor Locke is a very solid professor. She explains things clearly and in detail in lecture, and has a good sense of humor which keeps lectures engaging. She has very fair exams and does bonus questions. Nothing on the exams was surprising if you attend lecture or read the material (she makes it clear what sections are considered fair game).

summary_comment: The professor is highly knowledgeable and engaging, with great lectures and in-class demos that provide valuable insights. However, the lectures can be difficult to follow due to tangents and a lack of clear flow, and the course demands significant self-study and critical thinking. While the grading can be stringent and the exams challenging, the overall teaching quality is strong, especially when supplemented with good teaching assistants.

Ratings.comment: The lectures are so amazing, yet unfulfilling because you will have a hard time to grasp the flow of topics. Gives homework that needs serious brainstorming. Had to read a lot of literature to write the final paper and felt it was too much for just a 2 credit course. Plus point is that there was no final exam, only a final presentation.

Great lectures, the professor knows a lot on the subject. Only bad quality is that he sometimes wonders off from the topic being discussed and then the class notes will not mean much. You have to read the books. Good grades, though you have to work for it.

Course lecture is fine. But grading  was disappointing. Exam question seemed too much subjective being based on definitions mostly rather than conceptual or quantitative. Grading seems very critical as you need to be very precise in writing on what he prefers and receive 70% marks only for not writing comments in other people's presentation

I agree with the previous review.  He is a  much better teacher than is given credit for here.  Interesting and engaging.  If he has good TAs he will have them do plenty of very memorable demos too.  His poles during class are a good way to learn and give good insight for test questions.  O ya, and Greenland has a fiber-optic cable. (who knew?!?)
Very knowledgeable on every topic, especially the fiber optic network. Great lecturer and easy to follow during lecture. In class demos were very entertaining. So yeah, take his class!

Professor Myers rambles on and his lectures are almost incoherent. His homework problems are straight forward and not bad if you have read the assigned text. His practice exams are easy and his midterms are tricky. He is hard to follow and he speaks softly.

He definitely knows what he is talking about. However, he rambles on a lot and the lectures get very boring. Going to lecture is mandatory because once and a while he will let you know of a question on an exam and quizzes. His quizzes are super easy, exams not so much. Doing the practice exams are a must, or there is no way to pass the real exams.
Pretty boring lectures, often hard to stay awake and pay attention.  Clicker quizzes are usually pretty easy, homework takes a while but it's not that bad. Practice exams are pretty helpful.
Fantastic MSE teacher. Chemistry based material so a lot of people do poorly but fair quiz and exam questions. Do the practice exams, very relevant/similar to actual exams.

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Materials Science and Engineering Lab II

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as the lowest-quality instructor in the MSE department, primarily due to her lecturing style of simply reading from her slides and grading exclusively on exams. Students advise focusing on memorizing the figures in her slides, as they form the core of the exam content.

Ratings.comment: She literally just reads off her slides. She also graded solely off exams when I took the class. Worst professor in the MSE department by miles. If you're taking 3271 you probably won't have another choice of professor anyway but my advice is study the figures in her slides to prep for exams. That's the bulk of what she tests on.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as having a poor teaching demeanor and effectiveness. Students report disorganization, including delayed class publication and unpreparedness, and criticize the lack of comprehensive resources and fair assessment methods. Despite some noting improvement in later courses, the overall consensus is negative, emphasizing the need for constant attendance and meticulous note-taking to succeed.

Ratings.comment: Final was published 10 mins late, he was rude and dismissive of students questions and we didn't even get the 10 mins back. Unprepared to teach from day 1, this class was online and wasn't published until the first day of class. There were only 2 grades in the class, the midterm and the final because he didn't want to hire a TA to grade hw.
stank ass attitude towards teaching

I've had him twice. 3/5 the first time, 5/5 the second time. If you're reading this, you're probably about to have him for the first time. Go to every lecture, take detailed notes. Even if you already know it. He tends to repeat things with minor adjustments. If you zone out, you'll end up in a bad spot.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. He's the only one that teaches a mandatory MSE class, so you just have to deal with it. The lecture slides and the homeworks, quizzes, and exams he posts don't help at all. If you have him and want a B or better, you better sit in the front row and copy every little thing he says and writes on the board.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. I missed 1 lecture that had the material that was covered on the midterm and is NOWHERE in the textbook and I got docked 3/10 points. Wouldn't be bad if the whole midterm wasn't 10. And if the class wasn't out of like 2 midterms and 2 quizzes. Easy to accidentally fail his class.

Three months into the course, our only assignments are one midterm and two quizzes, for a total of 22 multiple choice questions. The questions themselves aren't terribly tough - but they're so specific to Dregia's lectures and found nowhere in his lecture notes or the textbook. The only way to do well is to religiously write down every Dregia rant

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Mechanical Behavior of Crystalline Solids at Lower Temperature

summary_comment: Dr. Beach is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, known for genuinely caring about his students' success both in and out of the classroom. He is a valuable source of knowledge and advice, and goes above and beyond to assist his students.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Beach is one of the best professors at OSU. He genuinely cares about the students and wants you to be successful beyond the classroom. Take advantage of being his student. He's a wealth of knowledge and advice, and will do everything he can to help you.

SEI.Class Name: Materials Science and Engineering Lab I

summary_comment: Dr. Fraser is an expert in metallurgy but struggles as a teacher, delivering unengaging lectures with outdated and disorganized slides. Despite being willing to encourage class participation and effectively explaining concepts, his teaching quality remains average due to his long-standing complacency in the role.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Fraser is renowned in the field of metallurgy, but it's clear that teaching is an afterthought. He is boring and his slides are old and disorganized. He wants participation in class which is nice and he is good at explaining concepts. He's an average professor who has taught this class for over a decade and is complacent as a result.

summary_comment: Babu is a highly knowledgeable professor in metallurgy who effectively engages students with his humor. While he aims for deep understanding and can be challenging to follow in lectures, students find him effective overall. Grading can be stringent, requiring precise explanation methods that students must master.

Ratings.comment: Babu is one of the funniest professors in the department and he's very knowledgeable about metallurgy. He wants students to really understand the content, but he can be confusing and hard to follow in lectures. It can also be difficult to satisfy the graders if you don't explain concepts in the way they want. Overall he's a good professor.

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Mechanical Behavior of Crystalline Solids at High Temperatures

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Mechanical Behavior of Crystalline Solids at High Temperatures

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Mechanical Behavior of Crystalline Solids at High Temperatures

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Mechanical Behavior of Crystalline Solids at High Temperatures

summary_comment: Dr. Salmani-Rezaie is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by her kindness, extensive knowledge, and effective communication of course content. Her approachable and friendly demeanor makes her engaging both inside and outside the classroom, and students anticipate her growth into one of OSU's top MSE professors.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Salmani-Rezaie joined the department this semester and has become one of my favorite professors. She is incredibly kind, knowledgeable, and communicates the course content well. She is down to earth and is fun to talk to before class. She cares a lot and as she gets more experience, I can see becoming one of the best MSE professors at OSU.

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Electronic, Optical, and Magnetic Properties Laboratory

summary_comment: Dr. Gouma excels in teaching with a unique approach that fosters student passion and deep exploration of topics. She prioritizes practical learning outcomes over difficulty, making her classes engaging and meaningful. Her openness to tailoring the curriculum based on student interests, combined with her warm and caring demeanor, significantly enhances the educational experience.

Ratings.comment: No other professors teaches a class like Dr. Gouma. She is passionate about getting you to find a topic you're passionate about and diving deep into it. She cares more about you taking away things you may one day use than making the class difficult. She is open to changing the class based on what you want out of it and is so nice and caring.

summary_comment: The professor is known for his structured approach, including weekly quizzes and detailed lecture slides, which can be helpful with consistent study. He is described as passionate and dedicated to teaching, though his lectures sometimes include tangents. While some students found the class challenging and tedious, many appreciated his efforts to simplify complex concepts and his overall commitment to student success.

Ratings.comment: Not pop quizzes but weekly quizzes. Had two drops which was lovely. Had to follow along in lecture if you're easily distracted but you can definitely read his slides and rewatch some lectures and it makes it easier. I liked attending bc of the spotify playlists in the beginning and also he said you do by attending and he wasn't wrong I guess?
Chill dude, told you what you needed to know for the quiz.

He often went on tangents/ side tracked while lecturing. Co taught - thought other prof was better. Class is basically read the textbook, 2 lectures, recitation and quiz each week. The quizzes are not that bad if you study/ review (I often didn't do... probably would've done better in the class if I did). Kinda boring and is a lot of lecturing.
This man roasdted me in class and ended my whole career  like 5 minutes ago.

Steve is passionate about teaching and wants you to do well. The homework takes a long time but is graded easily. You need to work in a group or you'll waste tons of time. Only downside is he forgets to respond to emails and fix grades or give extra credit he promised.

He is great professor. Honestly, I could easily say he has been the best professor I have had so far. His class is certainly difficult and if you want to do great I recommend reading the textbook, but he "dumbs down" difficult concepts and he is also extremely passionate about teaching.
Overall, the class was extremely difficult but if you show any type of effort (ie. Office hours, rewatching lectures, talking after class) you will be okay.
Very knowledgeable and a great lecturer

laid back and intelligent professor. The material is certainly difficult but there is no doubt about it- he could make this class much harder if he wanted to. Still, I feel like I have learned a lot in this class.

The good: Good/clear speaker. Interesting person. Loves metallurgy. One can appreciate his commitment to diversity. The bad: Frequently forgets to reply to student emails (or even act, as he indicated), on matters of importance.. Probably just a consequence of mass public education. Too much for one professor to do.

summary_comment: Professor Hwang is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, and he genuinely cares about his students' success, offering support when needed. His assessments are fair, with homework and exams closely aligned, and he allows students to bring a one-sided cheat sheet to exams. Jinwoo is noted for his clear and effective lecturing style, making complex topics accessible, though his classes can be quite large, which some find challenging.

Ratings.comment: Professor Hwang is very unintentionally (?) funny, and cares a lot about students. come up to him if you have issues. Only one homework this year, and 5 quizzes with two dropped. TAs were harsh graders.Waiting on final so expect B- to B+ for me.

Dr. Hwang is a great lecturer and his homework and exams were fair. The exam questions were similar to the homework, and he lets you have a one sided cheat sheet with anything you want. Make a good cheat sheet, redo the homework and you'll do well. I loved his jokes that came out of nowhere and how down to earth he was.

Professor Jinwoo is a clear public speaker. He teaches like a physicist, refreshingly. The content in Transport Phenomena is not difficult, compared to the companion MATSCEN3141 (Phase Transformations). There are no makeup examinations. There were about 100 students in one section, which strikes me as insane for a junior-level class.

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Principles of the Characterization of Materials

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Principles of the Characterization of Materials

summary_comment: The professor primarily handles recitation duties but occasionally takes over lectures, which students find engaging and enjoyable, often wishing he were the regular lecturer. While his colleague Flores is also effective, students clearly prefer the professor's dynamic and entertaining approach to teaching.

Ratings.comment: He is a professor mostly does Recitation work but sometimes steps in for Lecture. His lectures are fun and interesting and makes it awesome. I wish he was the actual lecturer. No points against Flores she is good too.

SEI.Subject: MATSCEN
SEI.Class Name: Individual Studies in Materials Science & Engineering

summary_comment: The professor is generally perceived as having a poor teaching style, with lectures described as disorganized, confusing, and often poorly structured. Students found the material difficult to follow due to numerous errors in slides and exams, and many felt the professor struggled to effectively convey information. Overall, the professor's lack of preparation and condescending attitude further detracted from the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: I wish her style was more interesting. She doesn't respond to email. She's inaccessible. She tosses up a word salad when she lectures. She's surprisingly easily distracted by everyday things in class (ie, people coming in late, the door, etc) for an experienced lecturer. Lectures from the previous term's co-lecturer & the TAs were most helpful.

The concepts are not terribly difficult, however this class is very disorganized, making simple things harder. The powerpoint slides have many errors, and my TA wasn't even an MSE major. The discussion board on Carmen was also useless. Overall, I was not impressed with this class, and if given the option I would have taken it with someone else.

I think Dr. Polasik is passionate about MSE but I don't think she's the best at explaining material. There's a lot of errors in her slides, on exams and on mastering homework. The book and recitations weren't very helpful. There were 20-25 multiple choice and only 55 minutes to answer them so make sure you work efficiently and avoid silly mistakes.

Alison wasn't awful. She's really interested in MSE and seems knowledgeable. There's a disconnect with her knowledge and ability to teach though. I used 9 notebook pages for 2010, lectures had very little knowledge passed on in them. She has errors in her slides and on her exams far too often. It still appears as though it's her first time teaching

Tests are tough!! Studied so long for the final and I still died! Dont expect a curve. Lots of online homework. Dont think the class is that bad I just really didnt go so I cant blame them for my grade. I will say beware conceptual questions on exams. You get a sheet of paper of notes for exams.

Alison is totally unprepared for class. She thinks using technology and group work is the only way you can learn but the system she uses fails at least once a lecture. She is very condescending and you can she thinks very highly of herself. Blames the TA's for every mistake, but the TA's openly admit she is awful. Unfortunately she is the only prof

You are required to go to lecture and she checks attendance through questions on Learning Catalytics. But her lectures are so poorly structured, no one actually knows what she talks about. She does not know how to explain topics. As a result, the Learning Catalytics responses are poor. She blames errors in her presentations on the TAs. Very bad!

I have had bad prof. She is the worst professor I had. Her lectures are no way helpful for the test. Test are easy but will have to read the text books. dose not upload homework solutions. I talked with one of the TA and she was also not happy with the way this professor teaches.
She was decent in MSE 2010. I don't have many bad comments. The TTT diagram part could have been taught better, but meh it's all good. Make sure you pay close attention in lecture

The class is interesting and Dr. Polasik clearly cares about being a good teacher.  She even brought in outside people to help us evaluate her.  She's helpful in office hours and is a nice person if you get to know her.  Recitation worksheets are very useful and her exams were easy if you did the homework and made a study sheet.
She is a good professor. The only problem with the class is that the lecture notes are not clear and there is too much HW. However, it is very easy to score a B in class.

I don't understand most of these reviews. The class was both interesting, and well taught. The material is well organized, and presented well. The lectures were helpful though sometimes a little dry. Recitation was incredibly helpful. It's clear that she cares about becoming a better professor, and values feedback.

1. Who is the TA? 2. Students' requests are always neglected or pushed off for so many funny reasons. 3. Easy and clear knowledge is taught in a messy way. 4. Handwriting is poor. 5. Lecture video is occasional and every video is extremely poor, both in sound and pictures. 6. Homework is too heavy. Remember, it is only a 2 credit course. 7. More...
It is not that hard to get a B- or B in her class, but if you want get better grade, it will be almost extremely hard.
Easy class, homeworks were simple and tests weren't challenging.

Terrible lectures. You're better off reading the book. Her lecture notes are the worst thing ever. Not up to date, not in the correct order, and does not contain all the material. I'm fairly certain she made these slides 5 plus years ago and lectures from the updated set of notes. All the different programs she uses are stupid and a waste of time.

Usually only go over one simple problem in a lecture. Also the grading scale is so ridiculous. Even though the grade on your paper is wrong, losing more point than you should, you can never get the points back, because the instructor just simply does not want to change the grade for you, and just does not want to give you the right grade. lol

Vague exam questions and very subjective grading.  Also lectures are so boring, always talking about the same materials over and over again, and always talking about how smart she is as an "metallurgist".
The saddest thing is she is the only instructor. Her teaching philosophy is to make exam question and quiz questions as vague as possible to lower the students' grade, and she made it.
The lectures are ridiculous, and the grading is ridiculous tough. The class is a joke.
Terrific class... Yes it's terrific you know.
Great magician to make super easy class ridiculously hard.
I like the teacher really works to make things easier

Get ready to bust out the book! Lectures are worthless, TA's seem to be more knowledgeable than the professor. Lecture is just her reading off a power point. Ask a question that is not exactly on the slide, and be prepared for a "Ill get back to you on that". Honestly, the material inst bad at all. The way its presented is a nightmare.

She is clear on what she expect you to know from the course. Uses LC quizzes to take attendance. Very good lecturer, I like material science more now. Just rewatch the lecture videos, everything she will ask is based on what she taught. Emphasize on materials properties most of the time
She was a really nice lady but not a great teacher. Very enthusiastic about material science but scatter brained and doesn't answer questions during lecture well

Very knowledgeable however not the best teacher. Her exams are fair and she usually has in class questions for attendance. If you read the book you should be fine. Make sure you complete all HW and assignments because that significantly boots your grade.
She knows a ton about MSE, but sometimes she was a little scatter-brained. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but there are little quizzes that are like using clickers. Very helpful in office hours!

The worst professor I have ever had at OSU.  She is confusing during lecture and teaches incorrect material.  On multiple occasions she taught information that was incorrect according to the textbook.  She is very knowledgable in her speciality however when it comes to general material science she is clueless.  Avoid at all costs.
